alert.note: Alert for Johnson (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 28 at 2:24PM MDT until June 28 at 3:15PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: The National Weather Service in Riverton has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Johnson County in north central Wyoming... * Until 315 PM MDT. * At 224 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 14 miles west of Powder River Rest Area, which is also 17 miles southeast of Buffalo, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. * This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Johnson County. This includes Interstate 90 between mile markers 71 and 92. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
